page.title: 17HIGHLAND FOLK MUSEUM (3)
page.content:
{JUBILEE YEAR (1985)}was a wonderful excuse to make the museum come alive. Events were planned throughout the summer to remind us that our history was full of people not just things.
Of course, the museum displays an {impressive collection}of every day things. Kitchen areas, farming scenes and spinning rooms are all set out; box beds, chairs and cupboards furnish a room; materials and fashions are on display. We all know how the rich lived; here we see how the{average {home}might have been.
In Jubilee Year, however,{crafts and {skills}were also demonstrated. On 2nd July sheep were shorn with hand shears, wool spun from fleece, horses shod, tatting demonstrated along with many other occupations and pastimes.
